item.title: Mountain Lions Terrified By Voices Of Rush Limbaugh, Rachel Maddow
item.description: June 23, 2017 - Scientists at the University of California, Santa Cruz were trying to understand the nature of fear for mountain lions. By playing a series of audio clips of political talk show hosts, including Rachel Maddow and Rush Limbaugh, researchers discovered that mountain lions fear people.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - Scientists at the University of California, Santa Cruz were trying to understand the nature of fear for mountain lions. By playing a series of audio clips of political talk show hosts, including Rachel Maddow and Rush Limbaugh, researchers discovered that mountain lions fear people. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/23/534143139/mountain-lions-terrified-by-voices-of-rush-limbaugh-rachel-maddow

item.title: 'Cause For Serious Concern': Invasive Carp Caught 9 Miles From Great Lakes
item.description: June 23, 2017 - A commercial fisher captured the silver carp beyond the barriers built to keep the invasive species out of the Great Lakes. The incident is raising alarms from local lawmakers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - A commercial fisher captured the silver carp beyond the barriers built to keep the invasive species out of the Great Lakes. The incident is raising alarms from local lawmakers. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/23/534105477/invasive-carp-caught-9-miles-from-great-lakes-in-cause-for-serious-concern

item.title: Could The Best Memory System Be One That Forgets?
item.description: June 23, 2017 - Forget thinking about forgetting as failure. Researchers now say that ridding our brains of irrelevant details and outdated information helps us better navigate our ever-changing world.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - Forget thinking about forgetting as failure. Researchers now say that ridding our brains of irrelevant details and outdated information helps us better navigate our ever-changing world. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/23/534001592/could-the-best-memory-system-be-one-that-forgets

item.title: Carrie Poppy: Can Science Reveal The Truth Behind Ghost Stories?
item.description: June 23, 2017 - After visiting a bookstore, Carrie Poppy started feeling odd: pressure on her chest and auditory hallucinations. She thought it was a spirit – until she found another explanation for her symptoms.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - After visiting a bookstore, Carrie Poppy started feeling odd: pressure on her chest and auditory hallucinations. She thought it was a spirit – until she found another explanation for her symptoms. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/23/533791342/carrie-poppy-can-science-reveal-the-truth-behind-ghost-stories

item.title: When You Talk In Your Sleep, Are You Talking To Your Secret Self?
item.description: June 22, 2017 - After hearing recordings of herself giggling and cheerfully talking in her sleep, Tanya Marquardt, who always thought of herself as tough and brooding, begins to connect with her other self.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - After hearing recordings of herself giggling and cheerfully talking in her sleep, Tanya Marquardt, who always thought of herself as tough and brooding, begins to connect with her other self. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/22/533952361/when-you-talk-in-your-sleep-are-you-talking-to-your-secret-self

item.title: 'From The Ashes' Documents Rise And Fall Of Coal In America
item.description: June 22, 2017 - After President Trump pulled out of the Paris Climate Agreement, former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg pledged to lead a group of mayors, governors and CEOs in cutting emissions according to the Paris framework. And now Bloomberg also has a film out documenting coal's rise and fall in America, From the Ashes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - After President Trump pulled out of the Paris Climate Agreement, former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg pledged to lead a group of mayors, governors and CEOs in cutting emissions according to the Paris framework. And now Bloomberg also has a film out documenting coal's rise and fall in America, From the Ashes. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/22/533989397/from-the-ashes-documents-rise-and-fall-of-coal-in-america

item.title: Yellowstone Grizzly Bear Removed From Endangered Species List
item.description:
June 22, 2017 - The Interior Department has announced that it will end federal protections for the Yellowstone grizzly bear.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/06/22/533989369/yellowstone-grizzly-bear-removed-from-endangered-species-list
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: How Do Eggs Get Their Shapes? Scientists Think They've Cracked It
item.description: June 22, 2017 - Eggs evolved over 300 million years ago and now come in all kinds of shapes, from Tic Tacs to teardrops to pingpong balls. After studying some 50,000 eggs, a team of researchers thinks it knows why.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - Eggs evolved over 300 million years ago and now come in all kinds of shapes, from Tic Tacs to teardrops to pingpong balls. After studying some 50,000 eggs, a team of researchers thinks it knows why. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/22/533840419/how-do-eggs-get-their-shapes-scientists-think-theyve-cracked-it

item.title: Moth Eyes Inspire Glare-Resistant Coating For Cellphone Screens
item.description: June 22, 2017 - The scientists who developed the anti-reflective film were inspired by tiny, light-trapping structures on moth eyes that help the insects avoid predators.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - The scientists who developed the anti-reflective film were inspired by tiny, light-trapping structures on moth eyes that help the insects avoid predators. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/22/533803686/moth-eyes-inspire-glare-resistant-coating-for-cellphone-screens

item.title: Forget Freud: Dreams Replay Our Everyday Lives
item.description: June 22, 2017 - Sigmund Freud thought dreams were all about wish fulfillment and repressed desire. But scientists now think they're linked to memory processing and consciousness. And they're often quite mundane.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - Sigmund Freud thought dreams were all about wish fulfillment and repressed desire. But scientists now think they're linked to memory processing and consciousness. And they're often quite mundane. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/22/533834764/forget-freud-dreams-replay-everyday-life

item.title: Republicans' Proposed Medicaid Cuts Would Hit Rural Patients Hard
item.description: June 22, 2017 - Hundreds of rural hospitals are on the brink of closing. The House Republican health plan drastically reduces one of their key sources of funding and the Senate bill is expected to do the same.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - Hundreds of rural hospitals are on the brink of closing. The House Republican health plan drastically reduces one of their key sources of funding and the Senate bill is expected to do the same. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/22/533680909/republicans-proposed-medicaid-cuts-would-hit-rural-patients-hard

item.title: Conservationists Try To Thwart Climate Change By Planting In Cold Spots
item.description:
June 21, 2017 - In the north woods of Minnesota, foresters are planting thousands of pine trees to try to protect them from climate change.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/06/21/533764318/conservationists-try-to-thwart-climate-change-by-planting-in-cold-spots
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Survivors Of Childhood Diseases Struggle To Find Care As Adults
item.description: June 21, 2017 - A few decades ago, babies born with conditions such as congenital heart disease or cystic fibrosis often didn't survive past childhood. Now many live longer, but adult medicine has not kept pace.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 21, 2017 - A few decades ago, babies born with conditions such as congenital heart disease or cystic fibrosis often didn't survive past childhood. Now many live longer, but adult medicine has not kept pace. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/21/532601431/survivors-of-childhood-diseases-struggle-to-find-care-as-adults

item.title: Dramatic Increase In Number Of People Being Hospitalized Due To Opioids
item.description: June 20, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish speaks with Dr. Traci Green, deputy director of injury prevention at Boston Medical Center about the stunning show increase in the number of hospital visits related to opioids.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish speaks with Dr. Traci Green, deputy director of injury prevention at Boston Medical Center about the stunning show increase in the number of hospital visits related to opioids. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/20/533698463/dramatic-increase-in-number-of-people-being-hospitalized-due-to-opioids

item.title: A Pioneer In 'Flat-Fee Primary Care' Had To Close Its Clinics. What Went Wrong?
item.description: June 20, 2017 - Many patients liked the Qliance approach, which gave them unlimited access to a provider for a modest fee and freed doctors from insurance paperwork. But critics say the approach may not be viable.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 20, 2017 - Many patients liked the Qliance approach, which gave them unlimited access to a provider for a modest fee and freed doctors from insurance paperwork.
